file_content.text: Republic Fleet Admiral Jedi Master Oteg requires your assistance. Meet him aboard the Republic dreadnaught Telos.
Scanning group facial features and matching to identifile records. Please do not move until this process is complete.
Identities confirmed. All of you are listed on Republic High Command's approved agents list.
Scanning facial features and matching to identifile records. Stand by... identity confirmed.
You are the Jedi Knight who defeated Darth Angral and saved multiple Republic worlds.
You are the individual designated "Barsen'thor" by the Jedi Council. This rank indicates a supreme level of trust.
You are leader of Republic Special Forces unit Havoc Squad. You are cleared for Indigo-level mission recruitment.
Your accomplishments are on record with Republic High Command. You are listed among its few recommended agents.
Opening holochannel to Republic Fleet Admiral Jedi Master Oteg. Stand by... channel open.
Hello. My name is Oteg. I serve the Jedi Order and lead the Republic's First Expeditionary Fleet. I need your help.
If a Jedi Master and fleet admiral needs me, the situation can't be good.
This must be bad news.
Good and bad are relative. Let's just say the situation is "interesting."
I'll help you if I'm able, but military operations aren't my specialty.
I'm not a soldier, Master.
Don't underestimate yourself. My officers sometimes trip over me, but I'm still fleet admiral.
Expeditionary fleets operate outside Republic territory, sir. Have we invaded Imperial space?
This sounds big.
My fleet is at the Imperial border. Whether we cross it or not depends on you.
You caught me between jobs, pal. Start talking--I'll stop you when I've calculated my fee.
Sounds profitable.
I hope you'll give me a patriotic discount.
I didn't know you could be a fleet admiral and Jedi Master at the same time.
You're a Jedi admiral?
I've had many titles in my lifetime. I prefer being called Oteg--it's shorter.
You didn't need to send a droid to loiter around the spaceport. My holofrequency is always open.
Why didn't you just call me?
My MP droids are equipped with advanced holochannel scramblers. We can speak more freely than over an open channel.
I've received intelligence that the Empire has a secret prison inside the Maelstrom Nebula. It's a dangerous region--impossible to safely navigate.
A Jedi prisoner possessing vital information is held captive there. I need your help to navigate the Maelstrom Nebula and free him.
You can tell me all the details in person. Give me your coordinates, and I'll meet you there.
I'm on my way.
What could this Jedi prisoner know that would be worth such a risky operation?
What sort of information?
Direct knowledge of the Emperor's plans. Insights the Republic will need to win the coming war.
Potential suicide missions aren't something I take on lightly--or for free.
That's going to cost you.
I had hoped for heroes--but I can afford mercenaries, too. You'll all be compensated for your efforts.
I admit it's been some time since I visited Tython, but I don't remember the order being quite so mercenary. Very well.
I knew the Republic military's budget was stretched thin, but I had no idea it was this bad. Very well.
The thing about being a Jedi is, you never need credits for yourself. That leaves plenty to share with others. You'll be well compensated.
I'm aboard the First Expeditionary Fleet's command ship, the dreadnaught Telos. Transmitting coordinates now--and please keep them to yourself. Oteg out....
Good day, Master Jedi.
Good day, sir.
Good day, citizen.
